/home.title: Fabricon - Fabric Contractors
/home.content:
Thank you for your interest in our fabric inspired products and projects.

Fabrics are our primary medium, our goal is to look for and select the appropriate fabrics for a project, whether natural or synthetic. Defining and matching an end products needs with the fabric properties improves the looks, performance and value of any end project. Though we focus and use a few choice fabrics, there are many resources that are virtually endless when it comes to our background.

Our construction techniques include sewn, welded or chemical bonding matching the construction technique that provides the desired outcome.

We work with and explore the most overlooked construction materials available, fabric. It has provided solutions to most of our needs since antiquity and a shelter few materials can truly show superiority when deployed and used correctly improvised solutions not available or found in other types.

Foremost, flexibility that allows for creative shapes in design, the ability to be deployable and used at multiple locations.
Second is Translucency allowing views to the sky and soft daylight to come through-LEEDS solutions to lowering the need for consumptive artificial lighting in the daytime while using nighttime lighting that turns projects iconic.

Todays technical fabrics and films are arriving in endless varieties which can be engineered
to the demands put on them. Whether it be as lifesaving fuse in an animal tracking collar or a 200M free spaned structure we look for the correct material for the job.


Fabricon is here to help put together your next specialty fabric project.

/about.title: About Fabricon
/about.content:
Fabricon as our name suggests focuses in the construction and use of specialty fabrics whether that be consulting, contracting and/or constructing in their applications.
Our palette consists of acrylics, cotton, glass, nylon, polyester, PTFE, HDPE while our expertise and list of materials grows.

While our focus is fabric, we continually integrate with many other materials whether that be aluminum, cable, concrete, steel, wood or composites.
Our products and services cover tents and tipis made from cotton canvas, awnings and canopies of woven acrylics, polyesters and pvc's to sophisticated tensile and frame structures created from a wide array of films and fabrics chosen for performance and needs of situations encountered.

Fabricon also provides metal bending/fabrication and decorating of the fabrics with various forms of signage.

Our services include design/consulting, engineering, fabrication and installation of specialty fabric products and structures locally and around the world.
Whether we can provide guidance in finding the optimum shape or best performing material for a project we excel/shine at one of a kind bespoke designs by providing advanced preparation in careful planning and material choices The world of technical fabrics is complex and rapidly changing as new materials and fabrication methods emerge. "Smart Fabrics" are playing an increasing role improving our lives while structurally engineered fabrics are being developed that can span immense spaces and achieve life spans of 50 years.

Fabricon was started in 1994 by Mark Welander . this following the sale and operation of Blue Star Canvas Products (beginning in 1977 as Blue Star Tipi until 1982)

Mark, has been a certified Master Fabric Craftsman since 1983 and received lifetime recognition as a Certified Master Fabric Craftsman in 2014 through the IFAI (www.industrialfabricsassociation.com). Mark has served on the Board of Directors of the Fabric Structures Association since 2008 and also received 9 international achievement awards, most recently the Award of Excellence for a frame supported tensile structure on the Rosebud in South Dakota and an Outstanding Achievement Award for a Tensile Canopy used as building entranceway at the University of Alaska Fairbanks.

/products.title: Products
/products.content:
Awnings:
are defined by code as architectural projections that provides weather protection, identity or decoration, and can be partially or totally supported to the building
that it is attached. Generally comprised of a light weight frame structure to which a cladding is attached.
while Canopies:
Are defined as frame structures or architectural projections incorporating fabric cladding that provide weather protection and identity. They can be structurally independant or supported by attachment to one or more buildings at one or more sides.
whether covering large spans or creating intimate spaces fabric can fill roles still only being imagined

Awnings alone are a proven solutions to cooling structures by providing shade and reducing glare over windows or entranceways, blocking the major source of heat gain and substantially
reducing the need to use air conditioning to cool a building.
Awnings can provide reductions in heat gain of up to 65%, lowering your buisiness or home's carbon footprint and costs associated with summer heat.
They also improve the appearance of a home or business providing identity and the ability to use signage or innovative lighting.

Awnings and Canopies can come in unlimited designs and styles, fabrics and colors. They can be a fixed molded shape or deployable in creative ways.
Fabricon can help design and fabricate the awning that gives your home or business its own unique identity
Styles include:
Retractable Systems
Accordian fold
Deployable
Rigid Framework
Curved, straight or free form


Heavy Duty Curtains and Screens:

Residntial, commercial or industrial we offer custom manufactured curtains and screens for emi sheilding, clean rooms, dividers, and facades incorprotaing creative lighting, graphics, sun and wind control, Curtains styles include roller, slide or stacked accordian style; manual or motorized.
Materials can be solid or mesh, decorated with pictures, graphics, lighting, or just left plain. we can define and offer options that will probably take your project further than you thought it could go.


Resource Links:
http://energy.gov/energysaver/energy-saver
https://youtu.be/bMbl7KMlXAY?list=UUu40QlwyMwERc15WLCZjZoA
http://awnings.ifai.com/home-awning-save-energy/


Fabric Structures:

Are characterized as having small mass relative to the applied load, which is determined by an optimization process. These type structures include air inflated, air supported,
cable net, frame supported, geodesic dome, grid shell, tensegrity (cable-and-strut) and tensile or tension structures.

Each system works incorporating fabric as cladding but rely on different geometrey and physics in the supporting framework and it's deployment. A frame supported structure, whether air, metal or other material, generally supports vertical loads in compression, a tensile structure must support the load in tension, a requirement for fabric, resulting in lateral loads not normally encountered in typical construction.
Fabricon can assist in determining these loads and assist in the feasiblity planning and price of a project.
We encourage our early involvement if fabric is being considered as issues not generally encountered can be understood and dealt with to avoid
costly changes or roadblocks that can hurt the feasibility of a project.

Fabrics are chosen to match the conditions and requirements of the project. we work with many type materials including PTFE coated glass, PVC coated polyester, ePTFE, ETFE, and HDPE

Custom Products:

Fabricon has and does a vast repritoire of custom projects covering military, scientific, agricultural, recreational and areas we have yet to do. Our work can be found on every continent on earth from the Arctic to the Antarctic, Mountain Tops to deep Ocean we understand and research the fabrics that perform as required and do whats expected. From prototype work to high tech projects incorporating the latest fabrics and on the market.


Consulting Services:
Guidance in fabric options and through Fabric Offerings and Selections, Prototype Design and Patterning, Fabric Engineering to all local and national codes, Project Management,



FABRICS:
Unlike most materials which have fairly lineal qualities fabric comes in many varieties and abilities. Defining the properties a project or product needs requires an understanding of fabrics and what is avaialable. what a fabric can do,
